bill_title: to authorize off-sale alcoholic beverage licensees to provide free samples of malt beverages and distilled spirits.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize off-sale alcoholic beverage licensees to provide free samples of distilled spirits. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 35-4-10.2 be amended to read as follows: 35-4-10.2. A licensee holding a license pursuant to subdivision (3) or (5) of § 35-4-2 may provide samples of wine, distilled spirits, liqueurs , and cordials to the general public without obtaining an additional license. The licensee may only offer as samples the wine, distilled spirits, liqueurs , and cordials that he the licensee currently has in stock and is offering for sale to the general public. The wine, distilled spirits, liqueur , and cordial samples shall be dispensed at no charge and shall be consumed on the licensed premises during the permitted hours of off-sale. No sample of wine may be larger than fifty milliliters and no sample of distilled spirits, liqueur , or cordial may be larger than twenty-five milliliters. No more than one variety of wine and one variety of distilled spirits, liqueur , or cordial may be offered for sampling in any one day, and no more than one sample of wine and no more than one sample of distilled spirits, liqueur , or cordial may be offered or dispensed to any individual. No wine, distilled spirits, liqueur , or cordial may be offered for sampling on any Sunday. A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize off-sale alcoholic beverage licensees to provide free samples of malt beverages and distilled spirits. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 35-4-10.2 be amended to read as follows: 35-4-10.2. A licensee holding a license pursuant to subdivision (3) or (5) of § 35-4-2 may provide samples of malt beverages, wine, distilled spirits, liqueurs , and cordials to the general public without obtaining an additional license. The licensee may only offer as samples the malt beverages, wine, distilled spirits, liqueurs , and cordials that he the licensee currently has in stock and is offering for sale to the general public. The malt beverage, wine, distilled spirits, liqueur , and cordial samples shall be dispensed at no charge and shall be consumed on the licensed premises during the permitted hours of off-sale. No sample of malt beverage may be larger than three fluid ounces. No sample of wine may be larger than fifty milliliters and no sample of distilled spirits, liqueur , or cordial may be larger than twenty-five milliliters. No more than one variety of malt beverage, one variety of wine , and one variety of distilled spirits, liqueur , or cordial may be offered for sampling in any one day , and . No more than one sample of malt beverage, no more than one sample of wine , and no more than one sample of distilled spirits, liqueur , or cordial may be offered or dispensed to any individual. No malt beverage, wine, distilled spirits, liqueur , or cordial may be offered for sampling on any Sunday. A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. BILL HISTORY 1/21/98 First read in House and referred to Commerce. H.J. 160 1/29/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/29/98 Commerce Do Pass, Passed, AYES 13, NAYS 0. H.J. 295 1/29/98 Commerce Place on Consent Calendar. 1/30/98 Second reading of consent calendar items. 2/2/98 Motion to Amend, Passed. H.J. 344 2/2/98 House of Representatives Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 44, NAYS 24. H.J. 344 2/2/98 House of Representatives Title Amended. H.J. 345
